title: Worksheet 2: Storing Your Numbers
description: Learn to use variables to store and manipulate data in Python.

problems.title: Simple Variable Assignment
problems.content: Variables are like boxes that can store values. We use the `=` symbol to put a value into a variable. Run this program and observe how the variable stores the number.
problems.task: Run the code to see how variables work.
problems.hint: The variable 'age' stores the number 10, and print shows us what's inside.

rules.description: Code must contain the variable assignment
Code must contain the print statement

problems.title: Using Variables in Calculations
problems.content: Variables can be used in calculations just like regular numbers. This program stores two numbers in variables and then adds them together.
problems.task: Run the code to see how variables work in calculations.
problems.starterCode:
num1 = 5
num2 = 3
result = num1 + num2
print(result)
problems.hint: The program stores 5 in num1, 3 in num2, adds them together, and prints the result.

rules.description: Code must contain the first variable assignment
Code must contain the second variable assignment
Code must contain the calculation using variables

problems.title: Interactive Addition with Input
problems.content: Now let's make the program interactive! You can enter two numbers and the program will add them together using variables.
problems.task: Enter two numbers and run the code to see their sum.
problems.starterCode:
num1 = first_number
num2 = second_number
result = num1 + num2
print(f"{num1} + {num2} = {result}")
problems.hint: The program will use the numbers you enter to calculate their sum.

rules.description: Code must assign the first input to a variable
Code must assign the second input to a variable
Code must calculate the sum using variables
Code must contain a print statement

problems.title: Temperature Converter
problems.content: Let's create a temperature converter! You'll enter a temperature in Celsius and the program will convert it to Fahrenheit using the formula: F = C × 9/5 + 32.
problems.task: Enter a temperature in Celsius and run the code to convert it to Fahrenheit.
problems.starterCode:
c = celsius
f = c * 9/5 + 32
print(f"{c}°C is equal to {f}°F")
problems.hint: The program multiplies the Celsius temperature by 9/5, then adds 32 to get Fahrenheit.

rules.description: Code must assign the input to a variable
Code must contain the conversion formula
Code must contain a print statement

problems.title: Simple Calculator
problems.content: Create a simple calculator that can add, subtract, multiply, or divide two numbers based on your choice of operation.
problems.task: Enter two numbers and choose an operation (+, -, *, /) to perform the calculation.
problems.hint: The program uses if statements to check which operation you chose and performs the appropriate calculation.

rules.description: Code must assign the first input to a variable
Code must assign the second input to a variable
Code must assign the operation input to a variable
Code must contain a print statement
